attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Physical stock take of all the items at the branch was done on 12/05/2025. The aim was to assess the strength/weakness of internal control systems put in place. Significant variances in stock items would be interpreted as a threat to the safety of the company’s items and vice versa.

·       Notable discrepancies were observed in the following categories:

·       Aggregate bread difference was shortfall of -59 pcs (White Bread) and excess of 39 Pcs (Brown Bread).

·       Aggregated polybags difference was excess of 1,525 pcs.

·       Wheat Bran difference was shortfall of -14.10 Kgs.

The table below illustrates the findings:
attributes.recommendation: ·       Strong controls on Stocks should be adhered to in order to minimize the variances.
attributes.effect: Minimal stock variances imply strong controls.

value:
·       Within the established limits.

·       Wheat bran short will be controlled.
·       Stock is within the acceptable limit.

·       In the prior audit report highlighted variations during physical stock verification on.

ü  Packing Materials: Variance of +470 pieces.

ü  Bread Stock: Variance of 98(WB) & -42(Brown) pieces.

Utto +4.11 Kg
Previous
A stock take exercise was conducted on 12th May 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place i.e. Raw Materials, Finished Goods, Polybags & Miscellaneous.
Stock had immaterial variances.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Strong Internal Controls are Put in Place.

attributes.title: Standard Bread Weight Check
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Packed bread samples were weighed on 12/05/2025 to establish if product released to the market was of the desired quantity.

·       The weighted was found to be within the acceptable range.

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Strict adherence to set standard dough weights in order to attain standard weight bread.
attributes.effect: Few cases of underweight implies bread weight standards are adhered to.

value: Bread weight is within the required limit.
Strong controls will be maintained.

·       In the prior audit,  underweight were noted in

ü  800g WB: 23% underweight

400g BT: 17% underweight.
Previous
Bread Weight is done for all the varieties.
Compliance was met, with minimal cases of underweight bread.
Operations/Production Department
To establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       An analysis of mixing charts and summaries was done to determine if the raw materials usage were as per the set BOM and if the set production standards were achieved.

·       An analysis was also performed to verify if there were any significant variances between the mixing chart summary and the SAP system.

There were no significant variances noted
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set production standards.
attributes.effect: Minor variances is an indication of strong controls.

value: To be maintained.
We will maintain.

·        In the prior audit, Physical and system material usage was matching

No variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.
Previous
Comparison of manual mixing charts and the SAP mixing charts was done from 17th April to 11th May 2025 to find out Manual Mixing Chart was matching with SAP System.
Set Yield, Consumption was observed apart from set production target which was not achieved due to less orders and cutting down production.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the set Yield, Consumption of Raw Materials and Production Bags is achieved.

attributes.title: Production and Market Damages
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Production and market damages were analyzed to determine their rate during production or from market and compare the same with the allowed standards. High production damage rate would suggest product of inferior quality was allowed to the market.

·       Allowed production damages rate is 0.25% of total production and market damage is 0.2% of net sales.

·       Production and market damage rate was analyzed from cash flow date 07/04/2025 - 11/05/2025.

·       It was observed that  production damages exceeded the KPI, while market damages remained within acceptable limits,  as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: To adhere to the set quality control parameters within the production process to minimize production damages.
attributes.effect: Excess production damages indicate a potential financial exposure amounting to KES 19,965.73.

value: The generator is still under observation.
The generator breakdown led to high number of oven damages.
In the prior audit, the production and market damages were 0.25% and 0.24% respectively.
Previous
The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within the set limits.
The production damages were higher than the set K.P.I and market damages were within the set limit.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring controlled bread damages.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Production efficiencies were analyzed from 17/04/25 – 11/05/25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.

·       Actual production efficiency was 4.87 bags per worker which is slightly below the set limit.

Below is a summary table of the findings

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: Management to improve on the planning of production to ensure set target is attained.
attributes.effect: The Production efficiency was slightly below the KPI. This implies extra cost of KES 6,519.60 was incurred to hire extra production workers.

value: ·       The production efficiency was close to the limit.
·       We are working towards attaining the KPI.
In the previous audit, the production efficiency was 4.91 bags.
Previous

This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs. Standard production efficiency is 5 bags per staff.
Production efficiency was not achieved.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring set production efficiency is adhered to.

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Packing efficiencies were analyzed from 17/04/25 – 11/05/25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.

·       Actual packing efficiency was 94.9 crates per packer which is slightly below the set limit.

Below is a summary table of the findings

Packing efficiency
attributes.recommendation: The branch manager should work towards attaining the set target.
attributes.effect: Failing to achieve the set target the company have a cost saving of Ksh.2, 736.

value: Noted.
We will improve to ensure the target is achieved.
In the prior audit, the packing efficiency was 97.9 Crates.
Previous
This test was conducted to determine if set packing efficiency was adhered to.
The packing efficiency was bwlow the set target.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure set packing efficiency is achieved.

attributes.title: Physical Cash Verification.
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Physical cash was verified on 12/05/2025, to confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

No material Variance was noted 

Cash Balance 54,512.37

Cash at Hand 54,495

Variance: -17
attributes.recommendation: It is recommended to continue monitoring fuel consumption closely.
attributes.effect: Cash loss risk is minimal. This implies strong controls.

value: Strong controls to be maintained.
The consumption is within the set standard rate.
In the prior audit report, No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
Previous
Physical cash was verified on 12/05/2025 to check whether cash counted matched that on SAP balances.
Minimal cash variance suggest effective controls were put in place.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Cash Controls are strong.

attributes.title: Mileage Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·         Analysis of motor vehicle fuel purchase and usage was done from 01/04/25 - 30/04/25 assess compliance to company policies and results were analyzed.

·         It Fuel efficiency for the assessed vehicles was found to be within the acceptable performance parameters.
attributes.recommendation: Low fuel consumption. This implies the controls are effective.
attributes.effect: Low fuel consumption. This implies the controls are effective.

value: Strong controls to be maintained.
The consumption is within the set standard rate.
In the prior audit report, the actual consumption rate for KCJ 335L and KCJ 335L was 6.86 and 6.20 respectively.
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file.
Effective fuel consumption
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring that all sales vans fuel consumption is as per set standards.

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Fuel consumption tests were carried out to determine if set consumption standards for sales vans were adhered to.

·       Standard fuel consumption for the branch generator was  26.6L/HR

·       Generator fuel consumption from 01/04/2025 – 30/04/2025 is analyzed on the below table.

·       It was noted that the average fuel consumption was 25.23 l/hr. which is slightly below the standard rate by 1.37l/hr.
attributes.recommendation: Continue periodic monitoring to ensure the rate remains within acceptable limits.
attributes.effect: The consumption rate was within acceptable limits, indicating that controls are effective.

value: Fuel Consumption is economical and within acceptable usage levels.
Strong controls on generator fuel consumption will be maintained.
In the prior audit, consumption rate was 29.98 L/HR.
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption was economical.
The consumption rate was within the set standard rate.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring generator fuel is fully utilized.
